pullRequest.body:
This PR defines Hasse derivatives of formal Laurent series using integer binomial coefficients, and proves some basic properties.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Thanks!

bors d+

:v: ScottCarnahan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8577460891/job/23510075372)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8577460891/job/23510075474)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8577460891/job/23510075696)

Thanks for doing this (and sorry for such a slow review). I have left some minor in-line comments on style but I think what we should really do is make the following definition instead:
```lean
def hasseDeriv (k : ℕ) : LaurentSeries V →ₗ[R] LaurentSeries V where
  toFun f := HahnSeries.ofSuppBddBelow
    (fun (n : ℤ) => (Ring.choose (n + k) k) • f.coeff (n + k))
    (forallLTEqZero_supp_BddBelow _ (f.order - k : ℤ)
    (fun _ h_lt ↦ by rw [coeff_eq_zero_of_lt_order <| lt_sub_iff_add_lt.mp h_lt, smul_zero]))
  map_add' f g := by
    -- Your proof here
    sorry
  map_smul' r f := by
    -- Your proof here
    sorry
```

I think this lemma is too close to `coeff_eq_zero_of_lt_order` to justify its existence. I see you are using it for the definition below, but it can be inlined.
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  HahnSeries.ofSuppBddBelow
    (fun (n : ℤ) => (Ring.choose (n + k) k) • f.coeff (n + k))
    (forallLTEqZero_supp_BddBelow _ (f.order - k : ℤ)
    (fun _ h_lt ↦ by rw [coeff_eq_zero_of_lt_order <| lt_sub_iff_add_lt.mp h_lt, smul_zero]))

```

I've never worked in this part of the library but I'll comment that the awkwardness of having to provide the `BddBelow` proof could be avoided with a junk value convention in `HahnSeries.ofSuppBddBelow`.
That is an interesting observation that had not occurred to me.  I still don't understand the full calculus of costs and benefits of conventions that require breaking into cases.

I claim it is better to avoid line breaks within terms in situations like this. Also we should really be consistent about use of dot notation. So I suggest:
```suggestion
theorem hasseDeriv_coeff (k : ℕ) (f : LaurentSeries V) (n : ℤ) :
    (hasseDeriv k f).coeff n = Ring.choose (n + k) k • f.coeff (n + k) :=
  rfl
```
Similarly below

If you like you can golf this using a cheap trick to stop `smul_comm` looping inside `simp`:
```suggestion
    simp [smul_comm r]
```

Now that the type of `hasseDeriv` is a linear map, we don't need these lemmas as they are just less general forms of [map_add](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Hom/Defs.html#map_add) and [map_smul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Hom.html#map_smul)
```suggestion
```

This looks like it is probably not pulling its weight either since it is just a combination of [map_add](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Hom/Defs.html#map_add) and [LaurentSeries.add_coeff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/HahnSeries/Addition.html#HahnSeries.add_coeff)
```suggestion
```
This last lemma I'm not sure about: the type classes `[Monoid S] [DistribMulAction S V]` are a surprise to me. Do you have an application in mind just that needs these assumptions?
I'm afraid I don't remember what I was thinking when I wrote that.  Perhaps it is better to just remove it for now.
I'm sure you'd remember if we hadn't taken so long to review.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LaurentSeries): Hasse derivatives of Laurent series
